title: ISic020574. ISic020574
body:
Facsimile Images

Ἄκκα

Apparatus criticus

Text after Arena (IGASM 2)

English translation

Italian translation

commentary

This would be the first occurrence of the name, which then appears in Plu. Rom. 4.5, Ἄκκαν Λαρεντίαν in Rome. However, another version of the name (Ἄκα) is found on a millstone from Adrano (unpublished?) and on a locally produced hydria (the text is painted before firing) from Montagna di Marzo dating to the early 5th century BCE (Arena IGASM no. 121; ISic020580). Another loom weight with identical inscription (ISic020573) was found in the same context.

bibliography

  • Arena 2002 113, pl. XXXII.1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001373
  • Brugnone 1991 55, no. 67 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002474
  • Dubois 1989 175c https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000187
  • Manganaro 1977 1337, n. 37 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001410
  • Dell'Aira 1965-1966 169, no. 86 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002479
  • Manganaro 1965 165-166 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001452
  • Orlandini 1962 110 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001465
  • Militello 1960 56, pl. 12h https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002475
